job.title: Software Engineer
job.description: We are a leader in penetration testing and attack surface management. NetSPI is constantly growing and looking for innovative minds to join us in helping some of the largest organizations in the world protect their technology and data from cyber criminals. if you thrive in a collaborative setting and enjoy working with best-in-class technology - we want to meet you!The Software Engineer will be responsible for working on and supporting our Red Team Toolkit (Attack Simulation). Red Team Toolkit is an offensive security platform and tooling suite for red teamers and penetration testers. The toolkit enables teams to perform advanced network operations, collaborate on target exploitation, and better simulate sophisticated adversaries.Responsibilities:Design, code, test and deploy application in an iterative development environmentDevelop code that is scalable, robust, and bug-freeDeliver high quality technical solutions to stakeholders in a fast-paced environmentDevelopment in accordance with industry standard and best practicesIdentify and analyze user requirements and convert them into a feasible technical documentWork with a geographically distributed team of various experience levelsRequired Skills:4+ years of hands-on experience with C#/.NET2+ years of experience using ASP.NET Core2+ years of experience in consuming REST/SOAP services2+ years of experience using React1+ years of experience with relational/NoSQL databasesBachelor’s degree in Computer SciencePreferred Skills:Experience using TypescriptExperience using C++ and/or Win32 APIsExperience using WPF/UWP/WinUIOpen-source contributionExperience working in Agile team environmentEffective communication skills, both verbal and written
